heroIntro: Discover your Mediterranean escape in this stunning 2-bedroom penthouse located in Playa Tamarit, Santa Pola. This 146m² holiday home offers the perfect balance of modern luxury and coastal living at €420,000—remarkably priced at €2,877/m² with premium specifications that cost 40% less than comparable properties in Spanish island markets. Imagine waking to Mediterranean breezes, spending sun-soaked days on pristine beaches just minutes away, and returning to your sophisticated sanctuary in one of Costa Blanca's most desirable beach communities. Whether you're seeking a personal sunshine retreat or a high-yield holiday rental investment, this penthouse delivers the lifestyle upgrade you've been dreaming of. The established international community in Santa Pola means you'll find English commonly spoken, excellent healthcare services, and all the modern amenities that make extended stays effortless. At this price point, you're securing not just a second home, but a gateway to the Mediterranean lifestyle that mainland Spain offers at significantly better value than the islands.
areaSection: Santa Pola is a charming coastal town in southern Alicante, perfectly positioned between the cosmopolitan energy of Alicante city and the quieter inland villages of Costa Blanca. Home to 16,000 residents, this authentic Spanish fishing village has evolved into a thriving international destination while maintaining its genuine Mediterranean character. The town boasts multiple Blue Flag beaches, crystalline waters ideal for swimming and water sports, and a vibrant seafront promenade lined with restaurants and cafes. The climate is exceptional year-round—over 300 days of sunshine annually with mild winters and warm summers. Playa Tamarit, where this property is located, is one of the town's most prestigious beach neighborhoods, offering direct access to sandy beaches and close proximity to the natural park of El Fondo. The combination of authentic Spanish culture, international amenities, and natural beauty makes Santa Pola an increasingly popular destination for holiday home buyers seeking genuine Mediterranean living without the inflated prices of more famous coastal areas.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Santa Pola revolves around beach culture, excellent dining, and a relaxed Mediterranean rhythm. You'll find yourself naturally drawn to morning paseos along the seafront, leisurely lunches of fresh-caught seafood at beachfront restaurants, and afternoon swims in the crystal waters. The town supports a thriving international community with English widely spoken, making it easy to build friendships and navigate essential services. Weekly markets burst with fresh local produce, regional wines, and artisan goods. The established expat network means easy access to everything from English-speaking healthcare professionals to familiar international brands at local supermarkets like Mercadona and Lidl. Beyond the beach, you're positioned for easy day trips to Alicante's cultural attractions, championship golf courses, and inland white villages. Evening entertainment ranges from authentic tapas bars frequented by locals to upscale beach clubs. For holiday buyers, the beauty is flexibility—embrace the beach lifestyle when you're here, rent it out when you're not, knowing you have a sophisticated, welcoming community ready to welcome you back.
investmentSection: This penthouse represents excellent value in an appreciating market. Santa Pola has experienced steady year-on-year growth of +8%, outpacing broader Costa Blanca trends as international buyers discover its authentic charm and superior pricing compared to more famous coastal areas. At €2,877/m², you're acquiring premium specification property at 40% less than comparable penthouses in Spanish island markets, yet with the same Mediterranean lifestyle and rental appeal. Rental potential is compelling—typical weekly holiday rentals in Playa Tamarit command €800, translating to €41,600 annually at 50% occupancy (conservative estimate). Many owners achieve 60-70% occupancy during peak seasons, generating €50,000+ annual rental income. The combination of strong appreciation potential, proven rental demand, favorable pricing relative to island markets, and the lifestyle premium creates a compelling investment case for savvy buyers seeking both personal enjoyment and financial returns.

You're acquiring premium-specification Mediterranean property at exceptional value—40% below island pricing yet with identical beach lifestyle and superior rental economics. The combination of €800/week rental potential, +8% annual appreciation, established international community, and comprehensive modern amenities creates compelling ownership logic. healthcare.text: Healthcare in Santa Pola meets international standards with excellent facilities and English-speaking medical professionals readily available. The nearby Hospital Marina Salud serves the region with comprehensive emergency and specialist services within 20 kilometers. Private clinics throughout the area cater specifically to international patients, with many doctors trained in English-speaking countries. For routine medical needs, modern health centers are conveniently located in town with bilingual staff. Medical tourism is well-established on Costa Blanca, meaning quality healthcare providers actively cater to international clientele. Travel insurance and private Spanish health insurance are affordable options for holiday home owners, providing peace of mind alongside Spain's excellent public healthcare system.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca et godt sted å kjøpe eiendom?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is excellent for property investment and holiday home ownership. The region experiences consistent appreciation (+8% year-on-year in Santa Pola), offers proven rental demand, boasts established international communities, and provides Mediterranean lifestyle at significantly better value than island alternatives. Healthcare, education, and amenities are modern and accessible to international residents.

faqs.question: Kan utlendinger kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without restriction. Non-residents can buy residential property as easily as Spanish citizens. You'll need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number) for the purchase, and standard mortgage financing is available to qualified international buyers. The process is straightforward with experienced legal representation.

faqs.question: Hva koster det å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect additional costs of approximately 6-8% including: transfer tax (3-5% depending on region), notary fees (1%), property registration (0.5%), and legal fees (1-1.5%). For this €420,000 property, plan for €25,000-33,600 in total costs. You can often negotiate some costs with the seller, and mortgage arrangements may reduce cash requirements.

faqs.question: Kan jeg få boliglån i Spania som utlending?
faqs.answer: Yes, international buyers routinely secure mortgages in Spain, typically covering 60-80% of purchase price with terms up to 30 years. Spanish banks actively lend to non-residents, though requirements include proof of income, employment, and sometimes a deposit. Interest rates are competitive, and the process is professional and transparent with English-speaking advisors available.

faqs.question: Hva er levekostnadene på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Santa Pola is significantly lower than Northern Europe or UK—typically 20-30% less depending on lifestyle choices. Food, especially fresh produce and seafood, is remarkably affordable through weekly markets. Utilities, dining, and entertainment are substantially cheaper than major UK cities. Healthcare and education costs are minimal compared to private options in the UK.

faqs.question: How much rental income can I generate from this penthouse?
faqs.answer: This 2-bedroom Playa Tamarit penthouse generates typical weekly holiday rental rates of €800, equaling €41,600 annually at conservative 50% occupancy. Many owners achieve 60-70% occupancy during peak seasons, generating €50,000+ annually. Airbnb, holiday rental platforms, and local property management companies make marketing and operations straightforward for international owners.

faqs.question: Hvordan er været på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually with mild winters (10-16°C) and warm summers (25-30°C). The Mediterranean climate is ideal for beach living year-round. Rainfall is minimal during summer months, though occasional winter showers occur. The stable, pleasant weather is primary draw for holiday home owners throughout the year.

faqs.question: Hvor langt er det fra Norge til Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is just 25 kilometers from this Santa Pola property and offers direct flights to major UK cities. Flight times to London are approximately 2.5 hours, making Costa Blanca accessible for weekend getaways or week-long holidays. Multiple daily flights from major UK airports provide flexibility and competitive pricing through budget and traditional carriers.

faqs.question: Why is this property priced less than Spanish island properties?
faqs.answer: Santa Pola mainland locations offer identical Mediterranean lifestyle and beach access to island properties at significantly better pricing. The 40% discount reflects Costa Blanca's authentic character compared to island tourist markets, yet with superior investment fundamentals including +8% annual appreciation, proven rental demand, and lower property costs. Smart buyers recognize the value differential while capturing the same Mediterranean experience.
